title: Compiling crate `fixed` for thumbv6m-none-eabi with opt-level=s spins endlessly in llvm::SelectionDAG::Combine

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: WG-embedded
labels.description: Of interest to the embedded Working Group

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

labels.name: ICEBreaker-LLVM
labels.description: Bugs identified for the LLVM ICE-breaker group

body:
Clone https://gitlab.com/tspiteri/fixed and apply: ```diff diff --git i/Cargo.toml w/Cargo.toml index 0d63145..4ecae7b 100644 --- i/Cargo.toml +++ w/Cargo.toml @@ -19,6 +19,9 @@ license = "MIT/Apache-2.0" edition = "2018" autobenches = false +[profile.dev] +opt-level = "s" + [features] f16 = ["half"] fail-on-warnings = [] ``` Run `cargo build --target=thumbv6m-none-eabi` — looks like rustc is hanging forever, LLVM is not making progress (see backtrace). (e.g. thumbv7m is fine, not using size opt is fine too, but this combo specifically hangs LLVM) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.47.0-nightly (d6953df14 2020-07-25) binary: rustc commit-hash: d6953df14657f5932270ad2b33bccafe6f39fad4 commit-date: 2020-07-25 host: x86_64-unknown-freebsd release: 1.47.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` (same on stable)
Backtrace
